author: Indiablooms
title: How PM Modi and others helped thwart potential Russian nuclear strike in Ukraine in late 2022: Report | Indiablooms - First Portal on Digital News Management
text: How PM Modi and others helped thwart potential Russian nuclear strike in Ukraine in late 2022: Report The United States enlisted the help of the international community as it “prepared rigorously” to avert a potential nuclear strike by Russia on Ukraine after Moscow intensified its offensive on Kyiv in 2022, CNN reported citing two senior administration officials. As the US feared that Russia might use a tactical or battlefield nuclear weapon on Ukraine, outreach from Prime Minister Narendra Modi and other countries played a significant role in thwarting the crisis in the later part of that year, the report said. The Biden administration reached the shocking conclusion about a potential nuclear strike by Russia based on not one but multiple developments, analysis, and – crucially - highly sensitive new intelligence, the report said. “Our assessment had been for some time that one of the scenarios in which they would contemplate using nuclear weapons [included] things like existential threats to the Russian state, direct threats to Russian territory,” one of the senior administration officials quoted by CNN said. Multiple senior administration officials took part in an urgent outreach. “One of the things we did was not only message them directly but strongly urge, press, encourage other countries, to whom they might be more attentive, to do the same thing,” another senior administration official was quoted as saying by CNN. US officials say that outreach and public statements from Chinese leader Xi Jinping and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi helped avert a crisis. “I think we believe showing the international community the concern about this, particularly the concern from key countries for Russia and the Global South, was also a helpful, persuasive factor and showed them what the cost of all this could be,” CNN quoted a senior administration official as saying. “I think the fact that we know, India weighed in, China weighed in, others weighed in, may have had some effect on their thinking,” the senior administration official added. “I can’t demonstrate this positively, but I think that’s our assessment.” In the context of the conflict between Russia and Ukraine, India has consistently denounced the killing of civilians and advocated for a peaceful resolution to the conflict. In a major statement, PM Modi told President Putin that “this is not the era of war” on the sidelines of the SCO summit in Uzbekistan last year. The statement was even placed prominently in the G20 communique under the presidency of India. During this period from late summer to fall 2022, the National Security Council convened a series of meetings to put contingency plans in place “in the event of either a very clear indication that they were about to do something, attack with a nuclear weapon, or if they just did, how we would respond, how we would try to preempt it, or deter it,” one of the senior administration officials said. Parallelly, Russia was allegedly spreading a fresh "false flag narrative" regarding a Ukrainian “dirty bomb”, a development that US officials were concerned might serve as a pretext for a Russian nuclear assault. In October 2022, Russia’s defence minister, Sergei Shoigu, made a series of phone calls to defence officials in the US, the UK, France and Turkey, telling them that the Kremlin was “concerned about possible provocations by Kyiv involving the use of a dirty bomb.” However, it is important to note that according to CNN, the US never detected intelligence indicating that Russia was preparing to deploy its nuclear forces to execute such an attack. “We obviously placed a high priority on tracking and had some ability at least to track such movements of its nuclear forces,” a senior administration official said. “And at no point did we ever see any indications of types of steps that we would’ve expected them to take if they were going down a path toward using nuclear weapons.” Support Our Journalism We cannot do without you.. your contribution supports unbiased journalism IBNS is not driven by any ism- not wokeism, not racism, not skewed secularism, not hyper right-wing or left liberal ideals, nor by any hardline religious beliefs or hyper nationalism. We want to serve you good old objective news, as they are. We do not judge or preach. We let people decide for themselves. We only try to present factual and well-sourced news. Support objective journalism for a small contribution. author: 小浪财讯
title: 中证1000增强ETF（159679）跌1.08%，半日成交额47.70万元|中证1000_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，中证1000增强ETF（159679）跌1.08%，报1.007元，成交额47.70万元。中证1000增强ETF（159679）重仓股方面， 同方股份 截止午盘跌1.69%， 百济神州 跌1.21%， 华测导航 涨0.02%， 安泰科技 跌3.50%， 兰石重装 跌6.16%， 京新药业 跌1.42%， 晶方科技 涨0.62%， 概伦电子 跌0.08%， 拓邦股份 跌0.30%， 宏达电子 跌0.78%。
中证1000增强ETF（159679）业绩比较基准为 收益率，管理人为国泰基金管理有限公司，基金经理为吴中昊，成立（2023-02-09）以来回报为1.92%，近一个月回报为1.46%。

author: M3 Web - http://m3web.bg
title: Israel: We Are Preparing For War With Lebanon - If Necessary
text:
Israel: We Are Preparing For War With Lebanon - If Necessary
[World](articles/category/30/World)| December 28, 2023, Thursday // 10:22
The Israeli army is increasingly preparing for a decisive expansion of combat operations against the Shiite movement "Hezbollah" in Lebanon, DPA reported.
"Today we approved a set of plans for the future, we must be ready for an offensive if necessary," Israeli Chief of General Staff Herzi Halevi said yesterday during a visit to the military command in the northern Israeli city of Safed.
The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) "and in particular their Northern Command have been put on very high alert," he added.
The Israeli army has been fighting incessantly with Hezbollah forces in southern Lebanon since militants from the Palestinian Islamist movement Hamas attacked southern Israel's border areas from Gaza on October 7.
Yesterday, units of the Lebanese Shiite movement fired rockets at the Israeli border town of Kiryat Shmona; According to Israeli police, material damage was done to several buildings. No one was injured.
At the beginning of the war in Gaza, for security reasons, the authorities moved tens of thousands of residents of the northern region to the interior of Israel.
Yesterday, three people, including a Hezbollah fighter, were killed in Israeli attacks against positions of the Shiite movement in southern Lebanon, the Lebanese news agency NNA reported.
The fighting in this theater of war, which broke out in early October, represents the sharpest armed confrontation since the Second Lebanon War in 2006, DPA noted.
But according to observers, they still continue to be conducted within the boundaries of certain unspoken rules. Both sides have so far avoided a more serious escalation of tensions.
The Iranian-backed Hezbollah movement virtually controls the government in Lebanon and has a missile arsenal that poses a threat to Israel.
In turn, the Jewish state is capable of inflicting enormous damage on Lebanon militarily.
In the Gaza Strip
Israel is expanding its operation against the Palestinian group "Hamas" in the central part of the Gaza Strip. Against the background of warnings from the United Nations about numerous victims and a severe humanitarian situation in the Palestinian territory.
The Palestinian side has reported over 21,100 dead since the start of the Israeli operation in Gaza. It began in response to the terrorist attacks on October 7 with 1,200 casualties. Ground operations are carried over to the refugee camps in the central part of the enclave. Fierce fighting is also taking place in the north in Gaza City and in the south in the second largest city of Khan Younis. Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas said an unheard-of crime was being committed against Palestinians and warned that the situation in the West Bank was explosive and Gaza was "unrecognizable". According to the Hamas-led Ministry of Health, 195 people have died on the Palestinian side in the last 24 hours.
In a telephone conversation with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, French President Emmanuel Macron reiterated the need to achieve a lasting ceasefire in Gaza "with the help of all regional and international partners".

author: rosa-falconi-johnson
title: Joe Biden solicitó al primer ministro israelí un alto el fuego en Gaza para proteger a civiles inocentes | Internacional | Noticias | El Universo
text: El apoyo de Estados Unidos al derecho a Israel a defenderse sigue siendo “férreo”, afirmó este jueves la Casa Blanca, tras una conversación telefónica sostenida entre el mandatario estadounidense, Joe Biden, y el el primer ministro israelí, Benjamin Netanyahu. “Nuestro apoyo a la autodefensa de Israel sigue siendo férreo”, dijo a los periodistas el portavoz del Consejo de Seguridad Nacional, John Kirby. “Se enfrentan a una serie de amenazas y Estados Unidos no va a renunciar”, agregó. Aunque la llamada telefónica entre el presidente estadounidense, Joe Biden, y el primer ministro israelí, Benjamin Netanyahu, se produjo en un contexto de “creciente frustración” de Washington con su aliado, informó la Casa Blanca. Publicidad Durante la conversación telefónica hoy con Netanyahu, Biden le manifestó que “un alto el fuego inmediato es esencial para estabilizar y mejorar la situación humanitaria y proteger a civiles inocentes”, indicó el secretario de Estado norteamericano, Anthony Blinken, en una rueda de prensa en Bruselas, tras haber participado en una reunión ministerial de la OTAN. Retorno de rehenes También le instó a que permita a sus negociadores concluir “un acuerdo sin dilación para devolver a casa a los rehenes” secuestrados por el movimiento islamista palestino Hamás tras su ataque a Israel el pasado 7 de octubre, en el que también murieron unas 1.200 personas. Biden avisó este jueves a Netanyahu de que el futuro apoyo de Estados Unidos dependerá de las acciones “concretas” que tome para minimizar el daño a civiles en la Franja de Gaza y garantizar la seguridad de los trabajadores humanitarios. Publicidad Ambos mandatarios conversaron por teléfono en lo que supone su primer contacto directo desde el [ataque que el 1 de abril acabó con la vida de siete cooperantes de World Central Kitchen (WCK), la ONG fundada por el chef español José Andrés.](https://www.eluniverso.com/noticias/internacional/siete-trabajadores-humanitarios-murieron-en-gaza-por-bombardeo-israeli-nota/) “Los resultados sobre el terreno son lamentablemente insuficientes e inaceptables”, aseguró Blinken, que se refirió a que el 100 % de la población de Gaza sufre inseguridad alimentaria y necesita ayuda humanitaria. Publicidad “Dejó clara la necesidad de que Israel anuncie una serie de medidas específicas, concretas y cuantificables para abordar los daños a civiles, el sufrimiento humanitario y la seguridad de los trabajadores humanitarios”, indicó, ya que “la política de Estados Unidos con respecto a Gaza vendrá determinada por nuestra evaluación de la actuación inmediata de Israel en relación con estas medidas”. “Si no vemos los cambios que tenemos que ver, habrá cambios en nuestra política”, insistió. (I)

author: VNExplorer
title: ¿Cómo manifestar una relación larga y bonita para el 2024?
text:
Un año nuevo está por comenzar, lo que significa nuevas oportunidades. Si te has preguntado cómo manifestar una relación que sea larga y bonita, ¡nosotros tenemos la respuesta! Atraer a tu vida una pareja no sólo es posible, sino que también se puede convertir en una aventura emocionante y divertida.
Aquí tienes algunos consejos súper prácticos para hacer que tu viaje hacia el amor sea inolvidable. ¡Toma nota!
Define qué es lo que buscas Antes de comenzar a manifestar una relación, es importante tener claro qué tipo de relación deseas. ¿Buscas una pareja comprometida a largo plazo, una relación más casual o algo intermedio? Tomarse el tiempo para reflexionar sobre tus verdaderas intenciones te ayudará a enfocar tu energía de manera más efectiva.
También puedes hacer un vision board donde puedas pegar imágenes, quotes, tickets y detalles que representen todo eso que quieres, así tendrás más claridad del amor que deseas que llegue a tu vida.
Reflexiona con mucha consciencia sobre todas esas cualidades que buscas en una pareja estable.
Practica el arte de la visualización creativa La visualización es una herramienta poderosa para la manifestación. Tómate un tiempo todos los días para visualizar cómo sería tu relación perfecta. Imagina cómo te sentirías, cómo se vería su vida juntos y cómo sería la dinámica entre tú y tu pareja. Cuanto más vívidamente puedas imaginar esta relación, más poderosa será tu declaración.
Trabaja en ti Una relación sólida comienza con uno mismo. Trabaja en tu autodesarrollo y crecimiento personal, y amor propio. Esto incluye trabajar en tu autoestima, establecer límites saludables, aprender a comunicarte de manera efectiva y desarrollar habilidades de resolución de conflictos.
Cuanto más te valores a ti misma y confíes en ti, más atractiva serás para una relación saludable.
Organiza una fiesta de manifestación ¿Por quÃ© no hacer de la manifestación de tu relación ideal una celebración? Invita a tus amigos más cercanos para que te ayuden a exteriorizar tus deseos. Pueden escribir mensajes de amor y apoyo que puedes guardar en un frasco como un recordatorio constante de que no estás sol@ en esta búsqueda tan importante, además, su buena vibra seguro que te da un empujón para encontrar el amor.
Toma acción La manifestación no se trata solo de visualizar y esperar; también se trata de tomar medidas concretas para acercarte a tus objetivos. Esto podría implicar salir y conocer gente nueva, trabajar en tus habilidades sociales, participar en actividades que disfrutes y que te permitan conocer nuevas personas, o incluso buscar citas en línea si te sientes cómoda con ello.
Cuantas más cosas hagas para lograr tu objetivo, es más probable que se manifieste.
Ahora que ya conoces cómo manifestar una relación pon en práctica estos tips para que pronto llegue a tu vida una pareja estable que te haga vivir momentos únicos y te haga sentir el amor, valor y respeto que tanto mereces.

author: @cmjornal
title: O homem que queria matar André Ventura e o pânico no voo SQ321 - Crime e Castigo - Correio da Manhã
text:
Aluno de 16 anos morre de meningite em Odivelas Enfermeira viu alemão procurado pela Polícia Judiciária junto ao Hospital de Viseu Padroeiro da Internet que morreu aos 15 anos vai ser o novo santo da Igreja Grupo rapta e marca rapaz com ferro em brasa na Moita Morreu Morgan Spurlock, o realizador que comeu McDonald's durante um mês para gravar documentário Letizia e Felipe VI já vivem separados. Saiba tudo aqui Taylor Swift faz a terra tremer? Investigadores vão medir atividade sísmica durante concertos Namorado de Taylor Swift já está em Lisboa e deverá assistir ao concerto da cantora David Carreira e Carolina Carvalho vão ser pais pela segunda vez? Saiba tudo aqui Veja o vídeo da incrível festa "Somos Todos Gamers" com os convidados especiais Inês Aires Pereira fala da separação As conversas comprometedoras que tramaram Fernando Madureira O homem que queria matar André Ventura e o pânico no voo SQ321 Quem são as vítimas do desabamento de restaurante em Palma de Maiorca "Os últimos sete meses têm sido um pesadelo": Irmão de jovem raptada pelo Hamas revela angústia da família IPMA alerta para aumento de caravelas-portuguesas nas zonas costeiras. Saiba que cuidados deve ter Pode visualizar no modo Podcasts CM Ocorreu um erro na subscrição, tente mais tarde! Crime e Castigo O homem que queria matar André Ventura e o pânico no voo SQ321 "Disse que queria matar-me". A afirmação é de André Ventura, o presidente do Chega, e surgiu no contexto de uma ameaça de bomba na sede do partido. Este é um dos temas do ‘Castigo e Castigo’ desta semana, onde falaremos também do pânico vivido a bordo do voo SQ321, quando o avião, de repente, ‘caiu’ 1200 metros num minuto. Um podcast de Paulo João Santos e Sérgio A. Vitorino, apresentado por Rita Fernandes Batista e editado por Bernardo Franco.

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Pedro Martinez Reveals Family Missing After Santo Domingo Roof Collapse
text:
Pedro Martinez Reveals Family Missing After Santo Domingo Roof Collapse
Pedro Martinez, a Hall of Fame pitcher, revealed that he has family members unaccounted for following the collapse of a nightclub roof in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic. This tragic incident occurred during a concert, resulting in at least 124 fatalities and numerous injuries. Martinez, expressing grief and hope, stated, "We are all affected," emphasizing a call for unity and strength among his fellow Dominicans in this trying time. The collapse also claimed the lives of several notable figures, including former MLB players Octavio Dotel and Tony Blanco, and Nelsy Cruz, sister of MLB All-Star Nelson Cruz.
By the Numbers- 124 confirmed deaths from the nightclub roof collapse.
- Hundreds more injured during the incident.
- The Jet Set nightclub was filled with over a hundred attendees when the incident occurred.
- Funeral services are ongoing for victims, with the community coming together to mourn.
As search and recovery efforts continue, there may be further developments regarding unaccounted victims. The incident will likely lead to discussions about nightclub safety regulations in the Dominican Republic, calling for potential reforms.
Bottom LineThis tragic event has highlighted the vulnerabilities within public safety measures in venues, urging communities to unite not only in mourning but also in advocating for necessary changes to prevent future disasters.
Read more at @foxsports
